org.rootsdev.polygenea

Interface NodeLookup

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Database

    public interface NodeLookup
    A NodeLookup allows nodes to change node references in JSON into Node objects.
    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite me if you benefit from this code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node lookup(java.lang.Object o)
      Convert a JSON value into a Node object by looking it up in some pool of objects.

    • Method Detail

      • lookup

        Node lookup(java.lang.Object o)
        Convert a JSON value into a Node object by looking it up in some pool of objects.

        The most common node encodings are UUID strings and integer list indices, but for future compatibility and to simplify interaction with Map<String, Object> representations of JSON the interface takes an arbitrary java.lang.Object.

        Parameters:
        o - The JSON value to look up as a Node
        Returns:
        The Node found; or null if o was null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if o is not a type of object that can be looked up, or it is that type but it does not correspond to any Node that this NodeLookup knows about.
